variable.name: F35VY
variable.comment: Visit year for which this form was collected.

variable.name: WALK
variable.comment: Think about the walking you do outside the home. How often do you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping? (Mark only one.)

variable.name: WALKMIN
variable.comment: When you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping, for how many minutes do you usually walk? Sub-question of F35 V1 Q1 ' How often walk 10+ minutes' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: WALKSPD
variable.description: Walking speed when walking for >10 min
variable.comment: When you walk outside the home for more than 10 minutes without stopping, what is your usual speed? Sub-question of F35 V1 Q1 ' How often walk 10+ minutes' (skip pattern rule not applied).

variable.name: HRDEX
variable.description: Times per week of very hard exercise
variable.comment: Not including walking outside the home, how often each week (7 days) do you usually do the exercises below? STRENUOUS OR VERY HARD EXERCISE (You work up a sweat and your heart beats fast.) For example aerobics, aerobic dancing, jogging, tennis, swimming laps

variable.name: HRDEXMIN
variable.description: Duration per time of very hard exercise
variable.comment: How long do you usually exercise like this at one time? STRENUOUS OR VERY HARD EXERCISE (You work up a sweat and your heart beats fast.) For example aerobics, aerobic dancing, jogging, tennis, swimming laps Sub-question of F35 V1 Q2.1 'Strenuous exercise - how often'.

variable.name: MODEX
variable.description: Times per week of moderate exercise
variable.comment: Not including walking outside the home, how often each week (7 days) do you usually do the exercises below? MODERATE EXERCISE (Not exhausting). For example, biking outdoors, using an exercise machine (like a stationary bike or treadmill), calisthenics, easy swimming, popular or folk dancing.

variable.name: MODEXMIN
variable.description: Duration per time of moderate exercise
variable.comment: How long to you usually exercise like this at one time? MODERATE EXERCISE (Not exhausting). For example, biking outdoors, using an exercise machine (like a stationary bike or treadmill), calisthenics, easy swimming, popular or folk dancing. Sub-question of F35 V1 Q2.3 'Moderate exercise - how often'.

variable.name: MLDEX
variable.description: Times per week of mild exercise
variable.comment: Not including walking outside the home, how often each week (7 days) do you usually do the exercises below? MILD EXERCISE. For example, slow dancing, bowling, golf.

variable.name: MLDEXMIN
variable.description: Duration per time of mild exercise
variable.comment: How long do you usually exercise like this at one time? MILD EXERCISE. For example, slow dancing, bowling, golf. Sub-question of F35 V1 Q2.5 'Mild exercise - how often'.

variable.name: BEERFREQ
variable.comment: In the last three months, how often, on average, did you drink beer?
variable.value: Never or less than once per month

variable.name: BEERSERV
variable.comment: In the last three months, what was your usual serving size of beer?

variable.name: WINEFREQ
variable.comment: In the last three months, how often, on average, did you drink wine?
variable.value: Never or less than once per month

variable.name: WINESERV
variable.comment: In the last three months, what was your usual serving size of wine?

variable.name: LIQRFREQ
variable.comment: In the last three months, how often, on average, did you drink liquor?
variable.value: Never or less than once per month

variable.name: LIQRSERV
variable.comment: In the last three months, what was your usual serving size of liquor?

variable.name: CIGSDAY
variable.comment: How many cigarettes do you usually smoke each day? Sub-question of F35 V1 Q4 'Do you smoke cigarettes now'.

variable.name: TEPIWK
variable.description: Episodes recreational phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 2.1, 2.3, and 2.5. Total number of episodes per week of recreational physical activity (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: LEPITOT
variable.description: Episodes recreational phys activity per week >= 20 Min
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5 and 2.6. Episodes per week of recreational physical activity of >=20 minutes duration (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: MSEPIWK
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1.2, 2.1, and 2.3. Episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: XLMSEPI
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous activity >= 20 min/week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3 and 2.4. Episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity of >=20 minutes duration (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: LMSEPI
variable.description: Episodes moderate to strenuous activity >=20 min/week (categ)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, and 2.4. Categorical variable of episodes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity of >= 20 minutes duration (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity). Computed from XLMSEPI and TEPIWK.

variable.name: SEPIWK
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, question 2.1. Episodes per week of strenuous recreational physical activity.

variable.name: TMINWK
variable.description: Minutes of recreational phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5, and 2.6. Total minutes per week of recreational physical activity (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: MSMINWK
variable.description: Minutes of moderate to strenuous activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.2, 2.1, and 2.3. Minutes per week of moderate and strenuous recreational physical activity (includes walking fairly fast or very fast, moderate physical activity and strenuous physical activity).

variable.name: SMINWK
variable.description: Minutes of strenuous phys activity per week
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 2.1 and 2.2. Minutes per week of strenuous recreational physical activity).

variable.name: TEXPWK
variable.description: Total energy expend from recreational phys activity (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5, and 2.6. Total MET-hours per week. Expenditure of energy from recreational physical activity (includes walking, mild, moderate and strenuous physical activity in kcal/week/kg).

variable.name: WALKEXP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, and 1.2. Expenditure of energy from physical activity from walking in kcal/week/kg (MET-hours per week).

variable.name: AVWKEXP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1 and 1.2. Energy expenditure from average walking (2-3 mph) in MET-hours per week. If question 1.2 (speed of walking) was marked as don't know or was missing, the speed was assumed to be 2-3 mph.

variable.name: FFWKEXP
variable.description: Energy expend from walking fairly fast (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1 and 1.2. Energy expenditure from walking fairly fast (3-4 mph) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: VFWKEXP
variable.description: Energy expend from walking very fast (MET-hours/week)
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 1, 1.1, and 1.2. Energy expenditure from walking very fast (> 4 mph) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: HARDEXP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 2.1 and 2.2. Energy expenditure from strenuous or very hard exercise (for example, aerobics, aerobic dancing, jogging, tennis, swimming laps) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: MODEXP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 2.3 and 2.4. Energy expenditure from moderate exercise (for example, biking outdoors, using an exercise machine, calisthenics, easy swimming, popular or folk dancing) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: MILDEXP
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 2.5 and 2.6. Energy expenditure from mild exercise (for example, slow dancing, bowling, golf) in MET-hours per week.

variable.name: ALCSWK
variable.comment: Computed from Form 35, questions 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3. Number of servings per week of beer, wine and/or liquor based on a medium serving size which is 12oz of beer, 6oz of wine and 1.5oz of liquor. If all three variables are missing, set to missing.
